meanings.definition: To adjust (an instrument) to a lower pitch.
meanings.sent1: I detuned my guitar to play a song in a lower key.
meanings.sent2: The piano sounded off because it was detuned.
meanings.sent3: The detuned violin made everyone laugh during the concert.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like a detuned radio, crackling with each note.
meanings.sent5: The detuned guitar strings created a melancholic melody.

meanings.definition: Not tuned to the correct frequency.
meanings.sent1: The detuned radio kept picking up static.
meanings.sent2: The detuned guitar produced a jarring sound.
meanings.sent3: The detuned clock was always running late.
meanings.sent4: Her detuned voice clashed with the harmony of the choir.
meanings.sent5: The detuned TV screen displayed distorted images.

meanings.definition: To make less effective or powerful.
meanings.sent1: The virus detuned his immune system, making him sick.
meanings.sent2: The detuned engine struggled to start in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: She detuned his argument with a clever counterpoint.
meanings.sent4: The detuned magic wand produced unpredictable spells.
meanings.sent5: The detuned amplifier distorted the sound of the music.
